games.title: Groovy Ski
games.shortDesc: Speed down snowy slopes, dodge trees and rocks in this endless skiing game.
games.fullDesc: Groovy Ski is a fast-paced HTML5 skiing game. Your core objective is to maintain your line and dodge obstacles (trees, rocks, etc.) on constantly changing slopes, sliding as far as possible for higher scores. The challenge lies in line corrections and lateral evasion timing at high speeds‚Äîeasy to pick up, quick rounds, perfect for mobile play during downtime.

howToPlay.basicControls: Mobile: tap left/right to change direction; Desktop: use mouse or directional controls.

Maintain small, continuous adjustments rather than sharp, large turns.
In denser obstacle zones, reduce turn amplitude rather than swinging frequently.

games.title: Snow Rider 3D

Players control a sled speeding downhill on snowy tracks; the key is timing‚Äîsteering or jumping before obstacles (logs, rocks) appear. Gifts along the path unlock more sled appearances and styles. As speed increases, trajectories become harder to control, testing reactions and line choices.

howToPlay.objective: Control the sled downhill, avoid obstacles, collect gifts and set distance records.
howToPlay.basicControls: Arrow keys/AD for steering, designated key for jump (see page hint); fullscreen toggle available.
tips: When facing consecutive obstacles, pre-align your angle for ramps to reduce post-landing corrections.

games.title: Penguin Skip

Master the rhythm and jump angle to avoid mistakes and falling into water. Simple rhythm yet highly addictive, perfect for mobile single-finger operation.

games.title: Color Tunnel
games.shortDesc: Dodge obstacles of different shapes in a high-speed colorful tunnel, testing your reaction limits.
games.fullDesc: Color Tunnel is a classic high-speed dodging tunnel runner. You move at high speed inside (and sometimes outside) a vividly colored tunnel, continuously avoiding obstacles with different shapes/rhythms. As sections progress, speed and complexity increase, testing your quick identification of "gaps" and lane-switching ability.

howToPlay.objective: Keep advancing in the tunnel and dodge all obstacles to refresh higher mileage/stage progress.
howToPlay.basicControls: Move left/right to align with gaps or openings; toggle fullscreen when needed for better visibility.
tips: Focus attention on "gaps" rather than "obstacles".
When patterns rotate/shift, reach the safe sector early to wait for the gap to arrive.
Maintain smooth continuous movement; avoid large-amplitude switches at high speed.

guide.basics: Speed ramps up quickly; establish a stable "see gap‚Äîmicro-move" rhythm early.
guide.scoring: Mileage/stage progression is primary; obstacles become more complex as you advance.
advanced: When facing outer tracks, slide along visible "groove lines" to reduce visual misalignment.
Identify common patterns (bar blockades, rotating blocks, contracting tunnels) and establish fixed responses.
In variable-speed sections, minimize full-width lateral moves to avoid over-displacement.
commonMistakes: Staring at obstacles instead of gaps, causing delayed movement.
Chasing gaps counter-clockwise on rotating obstacles, easily blocked.
Sharp direction changes at high speed, causing overshoot.

faq.a: Web (WebGL/HTML5); mobile compatibility depends on specific page implementation.

faq.q: How is it different from Tunnel Rush?
faq.a: Both are high-speed tunnel dodgers; graphics and stage layout differ, operation thinking is similar.

games.title: Death Run 3D
games.shortDesc: Fly through pipes dodging movable blocks in this hardcore reaction game with global leaderboards.
games.fullDesc: Death Run 3D is a veteran hardcore tunnel dodger. You fly at high speed through pipes filled with movable blocks; gaps are extremely narrow, requiring ultra-short reaction times for line adjustments. It features global leaderboards (Y8 Highscore), perfect for players chasing extreme scores.

howToPlay.objective: Navigate all movable blocks in the high-speed pipe, fly as far as possible, and challenge leaderboards.
howToPlay.basicControls: Move left/right (or up/down) to align with gaps; fullscreen recommended for better observation.
tips: Stay near the pipe centerline to reserve correction room on both sides.
Predict block movement direction, enter target tunnel "queue" early.
When vision is obscured, keep current direction with slight corrections; avoid large swerves.

guide.scoring: Primarily distance/survival time; submit to global leaderboards.
advanced: Establish fixed positioning for recurring patterns (e.g., "dual-column offset" prioritize outer lane).
Minimize back-and-forth lateral jumps; keep line stable after choosing a tunnel.
When facing consecutive tight gaps, use minimal "shake" micro-adjustments to pass.
commonMistakes: Turning only at the gap mouth‚Äîreactions too late.
Sharp direction changes after being obscured, causing collision.
Ignoring stability for speed, scores actually drop.

faq.a: Yes, supports global leaderboards (requires Y8 account system).
Depends on embedded version; typically instant challenge, no mid-run save.

games.title: Tunnel Rush
games.shortDesc: Classic high-speed tunnel dodger with continuous geometric obstacles.
games.fullDesc: Tunnel Rush shares the high-speed tunnel dodging genre with Color Tunnel, featuring distinct geometric shapes and intense speed variations. Players must find usable gaps in constantly appearing polygon tunnels, enhanced challenge rhythm through stage-based pattern combinations.

howToPlay.objective: Navigate different-shaped obstacles in high-speed tunnels, advancing through as many stages as possible.
howToPlay.basicControls: Move left/right to align with gaps; observe pattern rhythm to decide switching timing.
tips: Brief buffer before pattern switches‚Äîseize the moment to complete movement.
Prioritize positioning to "next segment's safe zone" rather than current segment's end.
When outer tunnel is passable, sliding along edge grooves is more stable.

guide.scoring: More stages advanced = faster speed, higher scores.

games.title: Yeti Sensation
